contentrichtext.text: '''Eleutherios''' ({{lang-el|Ελευθέριος}}, "the liberator") is an [[epithet]] of: *[[Dionysus]] *[[Eros (god)|Eros]] == First name == It is also used as a first name in modern Greek (alternatively transliterated as '''Eleftherios''', in the short form '''Lefteris'''): *[[Eleftherios Eleftheriou]] (born 1974), Cypriot football midfielder *[[Eleftherios Foulidis]], (born 1948), Greek iconographer, born in Drepano, Kozani *[[Eleftherios Mertakas]] (born 1985), Cypriot football midfielder *[[Eleftherios Papasymeon]], Greek athlete who competed at the 1896 Summer Olympics in Athens *[[Eleftherios Poupakis]] (born 1946), retired Greek footballer *[[Eleftherios Sakellariou]] (born 1987), Greek footballer *[[Eleftherios Venizelos]] (1864–1936), Greek revolutionary, statesman and charismatic leader in the early 20th century *[[Lefteris Pantazis]] *[[Lefteris Papadopoulos]] *[[Lefteris Papadimitriou]] ==See also== *[[Agios Eleftherios (disambiguation)]] may refer to two villages and one church *[[Eleutherius (disambiguation)]] *[[Soter]] *[[Savior (disambiguation)|Saviour]] {{disambig}} [[Category:Epithets of Dionysus]] [[Category:Greek masculine given names]]
